definition: lit. to follow the recipe (idiom)/fig. to follow a set pattern
as/as if/such as
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
variant of 法[fa3]
old variant of 法[fa3]/law
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])
to prepare herbal medicine by roasting or parching (in a pan)
variant of 炮[pao4]
to sauté/to fry/to dry by heating

to manufacture/to make

sentences.english: The same goes for other coddling behaviors, like pestering him to eat his vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 对于其它的溺爱也如法炮制，如劝他自己吃菜。

sentences.english: Wrestlers do it all the time to make a weight class.
sentences.chinese: 摔交选手为了达到某个重量级别总是如法炮制。

sentences.english: Then India would follow suit, as would Pakistan.
sentences.chinese: 印度和巴基斯坦也会如法炮制。

sentences.english: The next year, they make the same New Year's resolutions.
sentences.chinese: 翌年开春，他们又如法炮制了同样的计划。

sentences.english: The next day, he met his uncle, he did as the men told him.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，杰克见到他的叔叔，他便如法炮制。

sentences.english: Jobs actually did try the same thing with Apple TV.
sentences.chinese: 实际上乔布斯确实也在用苹果电视试图如法炮制。
